Articles.Content:
Hello guys, this is the report of my attempt to complete a Grand tour, maybe is no more so sensational as before but will be a great achievement... Let's start!

Quote

I believe that this program should commit itself to achieving the goal, before the 1.3 is out, if landing a kerbal on every body of this system and returning him safely, or not, to Kerbin.

-KKK

This is THE rocket:

Spoiler

Stats:

  • 80 m tall
  • 2295.322 t on launch pad
  • 347 parts
  • Manned by Bill and 1 Screwdriver
  • First stage Thrust 37.40 MN
  • 1,004,669+ 1 for Bill pay

And now, under the fairing we have this:

Spoiler

The SpaceShip is splitted in two parts: after kerbin orbit insertion the upper will tug the Eve lander and the Multi pourpose lander to Eve, while the lower to Duna for tug the lander among outers bodies. On the trusses at the bottom we have the Duna lander (on the left), the Laythe lander (on the right) and the Tylo lander (hidden behind the ship), they will go directly from LKO to their destinations. 

Stay tuned for more!

The modlist:

Spoiler

Atmosphere Autopilot
Better Burn Time
Better Time Warp
Indicator Light
Interstellar Fuel Switch
KAC
KAS
KER
KIS
MechJeb2
Modular Rocket System
NavBallDockingAlignmentIndicator
Node Splitter
RCS Build Aid
RealChute
SpaceY Lifter + Expansion
TweakScale

 

Edited April 9, 2017 by -DDD-

Launch!

On Launch Pad:
 

Spoiler

SpaceY, if you can think, we can launch!

Engines on!

Spoiler

And tower cleared (If only we have a tower)

Spoiler

Say goodbye at the KSC

Spoiler

Booster sep and Korolev Cross

Spoiler

First Stage sep

Spoiler

Fairing sep and circularization

Spoiler

Final orbit

Spoiler

 

Edited March 19, 2017 by -DDD-

I see you're taking the send-the-landers-individually approach. It's nice to see someone else do it, it always makes missions more... interesting. Make sure to set lots of KAC alarms.

Good luck!

55 minutes ago, IncongruousGoat said:

 

Make sure to set lots of KAC alarms.

Good luck!

 

Obviously, thank you!

Cool approach. Isn't the 1.3 patch being released this month? Better hurry up soldier

Have fun!

Mün and Minmus

This is the General Purpose Lander (a 4k battery with dawn engines, shamelessly copied from @Jetski), it will land on every body except of course Eve, Duna, Tylo and Laythe. I'm using KAS for switching between the double engine version (for higher TWR) and single (for higher D/v).

Spoiler

For the Mün I used the double engine version with 1100 unit of xenon.

Spoiler

Node splitting for low TWR

Spoiler

First Flag!

Spoiler

Rendezvous with the mothership.

Spoiler

The docking without RCS is very hard the first time, this took over 20 minutes of bouncing

Spoiler

after the docking the lander was refilled and reconfigured for Minmus, this time with one engine and 400 unit of Xe.

Spoiler

Spoiler

And the flag is in position!

Spoiler

Returned to the mothership, ready for the interplanetary travel

Spoiler

Links are only temporary, I will upload the screenshots on imgur asap.

On 19/3/2017 at 10:27 PM, xendelaar said:

Cool approach. Isn't the 1.3 patch being released this month? Better hurry up soldier

Have fun!

I know... lets change in "before I upload to 1.3"

Edited March 21, 2017 by -DDD-

The Great Split and First Interplanetary travel

The 1.2.9 is in pre-release and the clock is counting, so better hurry up to catch the Musk-like deadline!

At the mothership Bill detached some spent Xe tank for lower mass

Spoiler

Then dedicated lander was detached and prepared for interplanetary voyage, here Duna Lander:

Spoiler

Spoiler

Tylo Lander

Spoiler

Spoiler

And Laythe (sorry for the darkness...)

Spoiler

Spoiler

Bill detached also the supports of the landers

Spoiler

And the separation between mothership "A" and "B" (nomenclature by KASA)

Spoiler

Route of the two motherships

Spoiler

Spoiler

The mothership "A" and the Lander burn for Duna

Spoiler

Spoiler

And they are also first on they target

Spoiler

Spoiler

Tomorrow we will see the eve on Laythe  and maybe on Moho. Bye!

Still Interplanetary Travel and Gilly

A small update (seems that I have choose the worst period for this mission)

Landers for Laythe and Tylo burned for Jool

Spoiler

Spoiler

Eve Lander departure (this really happened after the jool transfer because I missed the window...)

Spoiler

 

The ship was first left in the same inclination of gilly and with an high apoapsis, for a more efficient transfer

Spoiler

Reconfigured for gilly landing

Spoiler

Intercepting gilly

Spoiler

Separation of the transfer stage (using KIS and on a suborbital trajectory)

Spoiler

And landing! First flag outside Kerbin System

Spoiler

In the meantime the ship circularised high over Eve

Spoiler

Eve and Moho

Welcome back and sorry for the long silence.
In these day Eve (!!) and Moho was conquered.
The landing spot:

Spoiler

I actually overshoot it and so the ship landed only 2300 m high...
Lander separation
 

Spoiler

Hitting the atmosphere

Spoiler

Heatshield opened

Spoiler

Near the surface it's decoupled

Spoiler

And landed, the shield survived and will remain for ever near the flag

Spoiler

(The lander is shameless copied from this, with few tweaks)

Now come the fun! The lowest landing site mean that we shouldn't reach orbit... but one problem at time...

Spoiler

The launch profile is quite simple: a straight ascent until 22 km and a slow gravity turn

Spoiler

I was right... We need 400 m/s...

Spoiler

Using the EVA pack to reach orbit

Spoiler

We made it!

Spoiler

The lander is used as a lifeboat for save Bill

Spoiler

Return to the mothership, now decommissionated

Spoiler

All xenon reserves and the lander were transferred on the Moho tug for the trip

Spoiler

Transfer orbit to Moho

Spoiler

And burning to circularize

Spoiler

In orbit of Moho

Spoiler

The lander is reconfigured for descent

Spoiler

Flag planted!

Spoiler

Reurning to orbit

Spoiler

Rendezvous with the tug

Spoiler

Coming soon the rendezvous with the motership at Duna, stay tuned!

Edited March 25, 2017 by -DDD-

Duna and Ike (With Imgur Album!!!)

And here we are again! Sorry for the long break but leaving Moho is actually harder than reaching. But the brave Bill achieved it on the external command pod of the lander. After the landings in the Duna system the ship is configurated for the trip to Jool Dres. 

 

Edited April 4, 2017 by -DDD-

Dres landin and Arrive at Jool

After some Dres love Bill goes for the first leg of the Jool-5

First Part of Jool-5 

After 19 year and 320 days Bill feel a bit nostalgic of home, but carry on! only two bodies to go!

Pol, Eeloo and the Grand Finale!

The last leg of the mission and the landing at Kerbin, a pretty fast landing.

Kudos, but I wonder how difficult it really would be to swap engines like that.

Regardless, a magnificent feat.
Thankyou! Do you mean to switch the configuraton of the Ion lander?
